intro: Galactia dubia var. guanicensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste Galactia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features compared to other Galactia species.
